speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: SCENE II. The Same. A street.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Enter CRESSIDA and ALEXANDER

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Who were those went by?

speaker: ALEXANDER
text_entry: Queen Hecuba and Helen.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: And whither go they?

speaker: ALEXANDER
text_entry: Up to the eastern tower,

speaker: ALEXANDER
text_entry: Whose height commands as subject all the vale,

speaker: ALEXANDER
text_entry: To see the battle. Hector, whose patience

speaker: ALEXANDER
text_entry: Is, as a virtue, fix'd, to-day was moved:

speaker: ALEXANDER
text_entry: He chid Andromache and struck his armourer,

speaker: ALEXANDER
text_entry: And, like as there were husbandry in war,

speaker: ALEXANDER
text_entry: Before the sun rose he was harness'd light,

speaker: ALEXANDER
text_entry: And to the field goes he; where every flower

speaker: ALEXANDER
text_entry: Did, as a prophet, weep what it foresaw

speaker: ALEXANDER
text_entry: In Hector's wrath.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: What was his cause of anger?

speaker: ALEXANDER
text_entry: The noise goes, this: there is among the Greeks

speaker: ALEXANDER
text_entry: A lord of Trojan blood, nephew to Hector;

speaker: ALEXANDER
text_entry: They call him Ajax.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Good; and what of him?

speaker: ALEXANDER
text_entry: They say he is a very man per se,

speaker: ALEXANDER
text_entry: And stands alone.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: So do all men, unless they are drunk, sick, or have no legs.

speaker: ALEXANDER
text_entry: This man, lady, hath robbed many beasts of their

speaker: ALEXANDER
text_entry: particular additions; he is as valiant as the lion,

speaker: ALEXANDER
text_entry: churlish as the bear, slow as the elephant: a man

speaker: ALEXANDER
text_entry: into whom nature hath so crowded humours that his

speaker: ALEXANDER
text_entry: valour is crushed into folly, his folly sauced with

speaker: ALEXANDER
text_entry: discretion: there is no man hath a virtue that he

speaker: ALEXANDER
text_entry: hath not a glimpse of, nor any man an attaint but he

speaker: ALEXANDER
text_entry: carries some stain of it: he is melancholy without

speaker: ALEXANDER
text_entry: cause, and merry against the hair: he hath the

speaker: ALEXANDER
text_entry: joints of every thing, but everything so out of joint

speaker: ALEXANDER
text_entry: that he is a gouty Briareus, many hands and no use,

speaker: ALEXANDER
text_entry: or purblind Argus, all eyes and no sight.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: But how should this man, that makes

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: me smile, make Hector angry?

speaker: ALEXANDER
text_entry: They say he yesterday coped Hector in the battle and

speaker: ALEXANDER
text_entry: struck him down, the disdain and shame whereof hath

speaker: ALEXANDER
text_entry: ever since kept Hector fasting and waking.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Who comes here?

speaker: ALEXANDER
text_entry: Madam, your uncle Pandarus.

speaker: ALEXANDER
text_entry: Enter PANDARUS

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Hector's a gallant man.

speaker: ALEXANDER
text_entry: As may be in the world, lady.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: What's that? what's that?

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Good morrow, uncle Pandarus.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Good morrow, cousin Cressid: what do you talk of?

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Good morrow, Alexander. How do you, cousin? When

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: were you at Ilium?

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: This morning, uncle.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: What were you talking of when I came? Was Hector

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: armed and gone ere ye came to Ilium? Helen was not

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: up, was she?

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Hector was gone, but Helen was not up.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Even so: Hector was stirring early.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: That were we talking of, and of his anger.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Was he angry?

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: So he says here.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: True, he was so: I know the cause too: he'll lay

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: about him to-day, I can tell them that: and there's

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Troilus will not come far behind him: let them take

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: heed of Troilus, I can tell them that too.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: What, is he angry too?

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Who, Troilus? Troilus is the better man of the two.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: O Jupiter! there's no comparison.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: What, not between Troilus and Hector? Do you know a

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: man if you see him?

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Ay, if I ever saw him before and knew him.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Well, I say Troilus is Troilus.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Then you say as I say; for, I am sure, he is not Hector.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: No, nor Hector is not Troilus in some degrees.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: 'Tis just to each of them; he is himself.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Himself! Alas, poor Troilus! I would he were.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: So he is.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Condition, I had gone barefoot to India.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: He is not Hector.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Himself! no, he's not himself: would a' were

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: himself! Well, the gods are above; time must friend

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: or end: well, Troilus, well: I would my heart were

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: in her body. No, Hector is not a better man than Troilus.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Excuse me.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: He is elder.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Pardon me, pardon me.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Th' other's not come to't; you shall tell me another

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: tale, when th' other's come to't. Hector shall not

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: have his wit this year.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: He shall not need it, if he have his own.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Nor his qualities.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: No matter.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Nor his beauty.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: 'Twould not become him; his own's better.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: You have no judgment, niece: Helen

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: herself swore th' other day, that Troilus, for

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: a brown favour--for so 'tis, I must confess,--

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: not brown neither,--

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: No, but brown.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: 'Faith, to say truth, brown and not brown.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: To say the truth, true and not true.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: She praised his complexion above Paris.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Why, Paris hath colour enough.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: So he has.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Then Troilus should have too much: if she praised

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: him above, his complexion is higher than his; he

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: having colour enough, and the other higher, is too

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: flaming a praise for a good complexion. I had as

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: lief Helen's golden tongue had commended Troilus for

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: a copper nose.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: I swear to you. I think Helen loves him better than Paris.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Then she's a merry Greek indeed.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Nay, I am sure she does. She came to him th' other

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: day into the compassed window,--and, you know, he

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: has not past three or four hairs on his chin,--

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Indeed, a tapster's arithmetic may soon bring his

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: particulars therein to a total.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Why, he is very young: and yet will he, within

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: three pound, lift as much as his brother Hector.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Is he so young a man and so old a lifter?

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: But to prove to you that Helen loves him: she came

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: and puts me her white hand to his cloven chin--

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Juno have mercy! how came it cloven?

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Why, you know 'tis dimpled: I think his smiling

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: becomes him better than any man in all Phrygia.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: O, he smiles valiantly.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Does he not?

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: O yes, an 'twere a cloud in autumn.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Why, go to, then: but to prove to you that Helen

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: loves Troilus,--

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Troilus will stand to the proof, if you'll

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: prove it so.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Troilus! why, he esteems her no more than I esteem

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: an addle egg.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: If you love an addle egg as well as you love an idle

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: head, you would eat chickens i' the shell.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: I cannot choose but laugh, to think how she tickled

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: his chin: indeed, she has a marvellous white hand, I

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: must needs confess,--

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Without the rack.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: And she takes upon her to spy a white hair on his chin.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Alas, poor chin! many a wart is richer.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: But there was such laughing! Queen Hecuba laughed

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: that her eyes ran o'er.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: With mill-stones.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: And Cassandra laughed.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: But there was more temperate fire under the pot of

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: her eyes: did her eyes run o'er too?

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: And Hector laughed.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: At what was all this laughing?

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Marry, at the white hair that Helen spied on Troilus' chin.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: An't had been a green hair, I should have laughed

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: too.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: They laughed not so much at the hair as at his pretty answer.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: What was his answer?

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Quoth she, 'Here's but two and fifty hairs on your

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: chin, and one of them is white.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: This is her question.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: That's true; make no question of that. 'Two and

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: fifty hairs' quoth he, 'and one white: that white

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: hair is my father, and all the rest are his sons.'

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: 'Jupiter!' quoth she, 'which of these hairs is Paris,

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: my husband? 'The forked one,' quoth he, 'pluck't

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: out, and give it him.' But there was such laughing!

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: and Helen so blushed, an Paris so chafed, and all the

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: rest so laughed, that it passed.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: So let it now; for it has been while going by.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Well, cousin. I told you a thing yesterday; think on't.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: So I do.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: I'll be sworn 'tis true; he will weep you, an 'twere

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: a man born in April.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: And I'll spring up in his tears, an 'twere a nettle

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: against May.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: A retreat sounded

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Hark! they are coming from the field: shall we

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: stand up here, and see them as they pass toward

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Ilium? good niece, do, sweet niece Cressida.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: At your pleasure.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Here, here, here's an excellent place; here we may

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: see most bravely: I'll tell you them all by their

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: names as they pass by; but mark Troilus above the rest.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Speak not so loud.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: AENEAS passes

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: That's AEneas: is not that a brave man? he's one of

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: the flowers of Troy, I can tell you: but mark

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Troilus; you shall see anon.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: ANTENOR passes

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Who's that?

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: That's Antenor: he has a shrewd wit, I can tell you;

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: and he's a man good enough, he's one o' the soundest

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: judgments in whosoever, and a proper man of person.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: When comes Troilus? I'll show you Troilus anon: if

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: he see me, you shall see him nod at me.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Will he give you the nod?

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: You shall see.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: If he do, the rich shall have more.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: HECTOR passes

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: That's Hector, that, that, look you, that; there's a

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: fellow! Go thy way, Hector! There's a brave man,

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: niece. O brave Hector! Look how he looks! there's

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: a countenance! is't not a brave man?

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: O, a brave man!

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Is a' not? it does a man's heart good. Look you

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: what hacks are on his helmet! look you yonder, do

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: you see? look you there: there's no jesting;

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: there's laying on, take't off who will, as they say:

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: there be hacks!

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Be those with swords?

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Swords! any thing, he cares not; an the devil come

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: to him, it's all one: by God's lid, it does one's

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: heart good. Yonder comes Paris, yonder comes Paris.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: PARIS passes

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Look ye yonder, niece; is't not a gallant man too,

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: is't not? Why, this is brave now. Who said he came

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: hurt home to-day? he's not hurt: why, this will do

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Helen's heart good now, ha! Would I could see

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Troilus now! You shall see Troilus anon.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: HELENUS passes

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Who's that?

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: That's Helenus. I marvel where Troilus is. That's

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Helenus. I think he went not forth to-day. That's Helenus.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Can Helenus fight, uncle?

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Helenus? no. Yes, he'll fight indifferent well. I

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: marvel where Troilus is. Hark! do you not hear the

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: people cry 'Troilus'? Helenus is a priest.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: What sneaking fellow comes yonder?

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: TROILUS passes

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Where? yonder? that's Deiphobus. 'Tis Troilus!

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: there's a man, niece! Hem! Brave Troilus! the

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: prince of chivalry!

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Peace, for shame, peace!

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Mark him; note him. O brave Troilus! Look well upon

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: him, niece: look you how his sword is bloodied, and

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: his helm more hacked than Hector's, and how he looks,

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: and how he goes! O admirable youth! he ne'er saw

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: three and twenty. Go thy way, Troilus, go thy way!

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Had I a sister were a grace, or a daughter a goddess,

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: he should take his choice. O admirable man! Paris?

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Paris is dirt to him; and, I warrant, Helen, to

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: change, would give an eye to boot.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Here come more.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Forces pass

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Asses, fools, dolts! chaff and bran, chaff and bran!

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: porridge after meat! I could live and die i' the

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: eyes of Troilus. Ne'er look, ne'er look: the eagles

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: are gone: crows and daws, crows and daws! I had

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: rather be such a man as Troilus than Agamemnon and

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: all Greece.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: There is among the Greeks Achilles, a better man than Troilus.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Achilles! a drayman, a porter, a very camel.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Well, well.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: 'Well, well!' why, have you any discretion? have

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: you any eyes? Do you know what a man is? Is not

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: birth, beauty, good shape, discourse, manhood,

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: learning, gentleness, virtue, youth, liberality,

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: and such like, the spice and salt that season a man?

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Ay, a minced man: and then to be baked with no date

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: in the pie, for then the man's date's out.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: You are such a woman! one knows not at what ward you

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: lie.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Upon my back, to defend my belly; upon my wit, to

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: defend my wiles; upon my secrecy, to defend mine

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: honesty; my mask, to defend my beauty; and you, to

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: defend all these: and at all these wards I lie, at a

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: thousand watches.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Say one of your watches.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Nay, I'll watch you for that; and that's one of the

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: chiefest of them too: if I cannot ward what I would

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: not have hit, I can watch you for telling how I took

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: the blow; unless it swell past hiding, and then it's

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: past watching.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: You are such another!

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Enter Troilus's Boy

speaker: Boy
text_entry: Sir, my lord would instantly speak with you.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Where?

speaker: Boy
text_entry: At your own house; there he unarms him.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Good boy, tell him I come.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Exit boy

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: I doubt he be hurt. Fare ye well, good niece.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Adieu, uncle.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: I'll be with you, niece, by and by.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: To bring, uncle?

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Ay, a token from Troilus.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: By the same token, you are a bawd.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Exit PANDARUS

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Words, vows, gifts, tears, and love's full sacrifice,

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: He offers in another's enterprise;

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: But more in Troilus thousand fold I see

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Than in the glass of Pandar's praise may be;

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Yet hold I off. Women are angels, wooing:

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Things won are done; joy's soul lies in the doing.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: That she beloved knows nought that knows not this:

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Men prize the thing ungain'd more than it is:

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: That she was never yet that ever knew

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Love got so sweet as when desire did sue.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Therefore this maxim out of love I teach:

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Achievement is command; ungain'd, beseech:

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Then though my heart's content firm love doth bear,

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Nothing of that shall from mine eyes appear.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Exeunt
